Posts.Title: Generics in Java vs .NET
Posts.Subtitle: A .NET developer's perspective

Background

I'm a .NET developer, writing C# code. But 9 months ago, I joined a company whose code is almost exclusively Java. As I have gotten more into writing Java code, I have become more aware of the differences between Java and my beloved C#.

Posts.Title: Building distributed apps in .NET with MassTransit

Introduction

So many apps that are being built today are part of distributed systems made up of two or more services that communicate with each other. They do so by sending messages, or publishing events. They are so called "Event-driven architectures".

Posts.Title: Introduction to .NET
Posts.Author: Marina Sundström
Posts.Excerpt:
.NET is an open-source platform for building applications for the Web, Mobile, Desktop, and Cloud. Currently, it is at version 5, which was released in November 2020.

.NET provides a runtime environment, the Common Language Runtime (CLR), an extensive base Base Class Library (BCL), programming languages like C#, VB.NET, and F#. On top of the platform you find many application frameworks, such as ASP.NET Core and WPF. It also integrates well with Microsoft Azure.
